channel.title: RSC Server In C
channel.description:
Hello, We probably don't know each other so i am going straight down to business. This is my second time on RSC, I tried the game about a year ago and now i felt like doing this . I want to do this as a group project just for fun but if no one joins then i will have to do everything myself like always, why would we do this? For fun and experience. If you want to join then you must have a solid understanding of either java or C/C++, preferably that you know how RSC(it's packet protocol very important) works and an understanding of the tcp protocol.
I think this is a little of how it will go down.
[u]Order of Business[/u] -Evaluate the source of a RSC server to see how it works overall. [This is what i am doing now] -Get an understanding of the packet protocol and get the packet encryption down if there is any -Get The Login part down and the pingpong. -Next comes walking and loading objects and npcs -Next is talking to npcs and buying items, withdrawing and depositing in bank and shit like that. -Fighting system is if i did not miss anything else before that
Thats it. If you wan't to join then post or pm me. I'm also open for any suggestions or comments on why this is not a good idea and shit like that.

item.title: RSC Server In C
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“russian b, post:14, topic:355866”][quote author=super_ link=topic=452410.msg3315613#msg3315613 date=1282288686]
a good start would be to use C not C++ and to use multiple files
[/quote]

I’m making a class for building packets so I’m using C++ Now.

whats the reason for this?

I stated the reason. I suggest you learn to read sir.[/quote]so why is the packet reading processed in the main source file?

also, the fact that you are using blocking sockets already indicates a horrid start, and that you are allocating a thread per client. and yes, calling ioctlsocket and setting it to non block would be a nasty fix, use a selector

additionally, c/++ is portable, stop limiting it to running on windows only

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server In C
item.dc:creator: @russian_b russian b
item.description:
@russian_b wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:356123”]Add me to MSN

luke@xa0s.com[/quote]

I added you.

[quote=“snoopy89, post:12, topic:355866”]What are you saying ?

A; You going to create a server from scratch
b; You will modify any source after your needs?[/quote]

I’m trying to make a server in C++ for experience, that’s all you need to know. I kind of like this game from back of the day and i thought since it’s a small game it wouldn’t be too hard of a project(although now i find it harder then i thought). It will probably take me a while to get anywhere since I have other things I’m working on too (I own a Gunz Online private server). BTW just to let you guys know there is probably no way in hell this will be released and taken seriously as a real server, however if i accomplish anything worthwhile and decide to give up this project or put it on hold I’ll release the source on here of course and i’m sure someone would continue it.

Read full topic

Hello, We probably don’t know each other so i am going straight down to business. This is my second time on RSC, I tried the game about a year ago and now i felt like doing this . I want to do this as a group project just for fun but if no one joins then i will have to do everything myself like always, why would we do this? For fun and experience. If you want to join then you must have a solid understanding of either java or C/C++, preferably that you know how RSC(it’s packet protocol very important) works and an understanding of the tcp protocol.

I think this is a little of how it will go down.
